title: How does a Bolometer Work?
subtitle: Measuring the Power of Incident Electromagnetic Radiation Through the Heating of a Material
about:
A bolometer consists of a radiation absorber connected to a thermal reservoir (a body of constant temperature) through a thermal conductor. 
The radiation on the absorber raises its temperature above that of the reservoir: The greater the radiation intensity, the more energy the absorber absorbs, 
and the higher its temperature rises. Hence, a bolometer can be used to measure radiation intensity.
